author: Staff Reporter
text:
A 33-year-old woman was found murdered with her neck slit in a bush at Madukarai near Nettapakkam on Tuesday. The victim has been identified as Sarala (33), wife of Gajendiran (43), a daily wage worker of Ramji Nagar in Madukarai.

Police said Sarala went to a nearby provisional store to buy some groceries. A few hours later, her body was found with multiple cut injuries on her neck and body. Locals alerted the Nettapakkam police who sent the body for post-mortem to the Government General Hospital at Kathirgamam.

Police suspect involvement of someone close to the victim in the murder. A case has been registered.

In Pudupet

In another incident an 80-year-old woman was allegedly stabbed to death at her house in Pudupet here on Monday night. The victim has been identified as Kanniyammal.

Police said the victim’s grandson Vinayak Velan (20), a construction worker questioned Shankar also hailing from the same area and his friends who were consuming alcohol near his house.

A few hours later Shankar knocked on the door when Kanniyammal, her daughter Malathi and grand daughter Muthulakshmi alone were in the house.

As soon as Muthulakshmi opened the door Shankar attacked her with a sickle injuring her.

Shankar also attacked Kanniyammal who came to rescue her granddaughter and fled the scene.

Neighbours rushed Kanniyammal and her daughter to the Government Hospital where Kanniyammal succumbed. A case has been registered.
title: Two women found murdered
